entry.title: We never used to do that (we don’t do that)
entry.summary:
Author: callmecranberry

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 69,976Chapters: 8/8Kudos: 201

Summary: “What the fuck, Buck. Look at us! We don’t do this, man. You can’t just up and leave after things get hard!” Eddie wasn’t sure how to stop being angry, how to not put everything on Buck, but his best friend leaving sure wasn’t helping. “Oh, but you can?” Buck snarled and Eddie looked at him in disbelief. “You…No. We’ve been over this. I know that you don’t think that I…” Eddie was lost for words but Buck quickly started speaking instead. “That you what, Eddie? That you didn’t leave? That you haven’t changed? That we haven’t changed? Because we sure as hell did. And El Paso wasn’t the first time you did it. It is your fucking thing." Or In the midst of their grief, Buck and Eddie fell out of their usual rhythm and went into two completely different directions. After a fight that took way too much from both of them and after the news that Eddie and Chris were staying in LA, Buck decided to move out and leave this thing between him and Eddie behind. Or Buck and Eddie have another divorce era right after the events of s8e17. We ignore everything that happened after that episode. Chris is a sweetheart, Maddie Buckley-Han is amazing and Tommy is only here as a plot device.

entry.title: there’s something in the static (I think I’ve been having revelations)
entry.summary:
Author: queerbaited_by_ABC

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,129Chapters: 1/5Kudos: 3

Summary: "Buck?" Eddie calls, voice soft and hoarse in the quiet of the hallway. Eddie, who Buck knows is only half-awake, sleep rumpled clothing and mussed hair, eyes squinting in the dark because Buck hadn't bothered to turn on a lamp.Buck doesn't respond. Can't."Hey," Eddie blinks, frowning and moving towards him. "Hey—Buck, are you okay?"His feet are rooted to the floorboards, muscles paralyzed as he stands at the edge of the hallway, too exhausted to take another step, too wired off adrenaline and shock to do anything but stare at Eddie.—-or: bobbys had enough of this coma, watching everyday as his wife and pseudo-son hold vigil over his comatose body, so he decides to fix it—and it starts with haunting buck.bucks just trying to make it through the week without getting committed to the psych ward or confessing seven years of repressed feelings to his best friend.

entry.title: The Gift Was Always You
entry.summary:
Author: IrishMum1710

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 612Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 6

Summary: Christmas Day brings Buck exactly where he belongs—surrounded by family, warmth, and love. But when Eddie asks him to stop by for a “last-minute present,” Buck walks into something quietly life-changing. In front of a softly lit tree, with Christopher proudly at Eddie’s side, Eddie chooses Buck out loud—without spectacle, without doubt, and without apology.This is a story about home, about certainty, and about love finally spoken when it matters most.

entry.title: Shower With My Clothes On
entry.summary:
Author: Luneclairevoyante

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 57,641Chapters: 4/8Kudos: 25

Summary: Evan got out of the car, breathing in the scent of water and wet humus. A barrier stood at the edge of a cliff, the lake at its foot. The urge to put himself in danger, to do something stupid and reckless gut-wrenched him as soon as he saw the opportunity. He climbed onto the fence, tiptoeing the edge.The boy wobbled, his heart skipping a beat. Wild with emotion, his arms flailed in the air to stabilize him as a peak of adrenaline rushed through his veins. That felt so good. Focusing his mind on the not-so-easy task of keeping his balance, he let a wide grin show on his lips for the first time in days.”Evan!” Margaret shrieked, and the surprise made him fall over, on the good side of the cliff, though. The boy tumbled at his mother’s feet as she pressed at his side.Now, he wasn’t invisible.☆✼★━━━━━━━━━━━━★✼☆Or, the Buckley’s move to Texas to avoid going to Maddie’s wedding. Sixteen-year-old Buck end up in Eddie’s school. Drama ensues.Or (bis), just a pretext for me to write about Buck’s and Eddie’s childhood trauma

entry.title: i thought you were gonna catch me
entry.summary:
Author: pointblanx

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,242Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 14

Summary: “You gonna tell me what’s bothering you?” He asked Eddie from the doorway. “Nothing to talk about,” was Eddie’s curt reply, pulling the silverware rack from the dishwasher and setting it on the counter. Buck pushed off the doorframe and pulled the rack across the island to put away. “I’ve got it,” Eddie said. “It’s fine,” Buck replied. A pause. “At least talk to Frank about it.” Eddie froze and recovered quicker than anyone could have noticed, except for Buck. “Y-you don’t see Frank anymore.” It wasn’t a question. “Don’t need to. I’m cured.” Eddie snorted. “Dude, you’ve been manic for the past week.” Buck could feel the energy shift as Eddie’s back tensed more and more. He moved on to loading the dishes into the dishwasher. Please let it hurt, Buck thought, skin itching for the brewing fight. “I know what you’re doing Buck,” Eddie responded. Hands on the edge of the sink, shoulders hunched, Buck thought he looked like a god contemplating his creation. “Is it working?” He asked. Eddie finally turned to face him. or, they fight and very important realizations are had.

entry.title: I Have a Dream
entry.summary:
Author: danu40k

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 896Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 21

Summary: As Chris lay in bed, his papa Buck having shown him the best speech he had ever heard from a man he had never heard of until now. He had been feeling down when Miss Flores had told the class that over the holidays, they were to write something on someone they honored and pointed out to him that it couldn’t be his daddy or papa it had to be someone else. He had really wanted to write about his family and didn’t know who to write about until papa had pulled up the speech he had watched and listened to when he came home that afternoon.

entry.title: Your Chains are Forged
entry.summary:
Author: blackrose_17

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,751Chapters: 1/6Kudos: 24

Summary: Edumndo paid no attention to them as he looked out the window up towards the moon, where he could see a thin veil that connected the world of the living and the dead. “Tonight is a night of magic. Where those gone may visit their loved ones. And for those who are in endless torment, try and do good to remove a chain or two.” Edmundo turned to look at them. “They always fail.” Climbing to his feet, he approached his son and daughter-in-law. “Tonight you will be visited by three ghosts. Christopher is in El Paso, and Helena believes she has won, but the spirits that appear at Christmas will not let her win. It is time for the Diaz parents to either change or keep forging the chains they have already made.
